answers.answer: Asylum is a form of protection that allows a foreigner who cannot return to their country of origin to remain in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Any foreigner who left their country of origin due to fear of persecution, serious human rights violations, or armed conflict can apply for asylum.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: One can apply for asylum either in writing or verbally, and an official can assist in filling out the application form based on oral statements.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Asylum can be applied for directly at a border crossing point or anywhere in Romania if one has already entered the country as a migrant, but not from outside Romania's territory.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: After applying for asylum, you cannot be deported, you will receive an application form and identification document, and you will be scheduled for preliminary and secondary interviews by the General Inspectorate for Immigration.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Asylum seekers receive a temporary identity document for asylum seekers issued by the General Inspectorate for Immigration (IGI).
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The purpose of asylum interviews is to determine a form of protection for the asylum seeker.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Asylum interviews are conducted in the presence of an IGI official and a translator, in a language the applicant knows, and a CNRR legal advisor or UNHCR representative can be requested to participate.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Asylum interviews are scheduled by the General Inspectorate for Immigration (IGI), and applicants receive a notice with the date and time for each interview.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Asylum applications in Romania are normally processed within one to two months by the General Inspectorate for Immigration.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Sprijin de Urgență is a platform where people can request or offer resources such as food, products, clothing, tents, transportation, or volunteers.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the section under 'Sprijin de Urgență'.

answers.answer: Sprijin de Urgență helps by allowing users to either request or provide resources such as food, clothing, tents, transportation, or volunteers.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the section under 'Sprijin de Urgență'.

answers.answer: Un Acoperiș is a service that provides support in finding temporary accommodation or allows individuals to offer space to help vulnerable people coming to Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the section under 'Un Acoperiș'.

answers.answer: Un Acoperiș provides support by helping users find temporary accommodation or by allowing them to offer accommodation spaces to vulnerable people.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/applying-for-asylum and read the section under 'Un Acoperiș'.
